cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW now, then curving northwest and north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming for south-central Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (between Cameron and Morgan City, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches expected Wednesday for northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet (warnings confined to Yucatan and Cuba at this advisory)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible Friday; low (≈5-11%) chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could bring 3–5 ft storm-surge inundation along the upper Texas coast and Sabine Pass.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches possible Friday into Saturday, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor river rises; possible short-fuse tornadoes in outer rain bands.
